description:
Last Saturday, I needed to grab an early lunch before my volunteer shift at Glide in the Tenderloin. Luckily for me, Taqueria Castillo Mason was one of the few (affordable) places in the area that were open before 11am. 

Out of the 2 locations in the city, I ended up stopping by the one on Mason Street since it was just a block from the church. Right as I walked in, I couldn't help but smile since Castillo pretty much epitomized Bay Area taquerias. The restaurant was quite small, they had a giant TV playing soccer, and you could get a bird's-eye view of the kitchen. Surprisingly, there were already some customers lining up for food so I didn't feel like a noob. In terms of options, Castillo had the usual: Burritos, quesadillas, tortas, tacos, and several plates. As far as meat options went, this place also had most of the usual (e.g. asada, chicken, chorizo) ... except for tripe unfortunately! Interestingly, prices at Castillo were not the "usual." Like one normal taco was almost $3, which was much more expensive than what I'd like to pay for. Although ironically, burritos were still pretty average ($10 for a Super).

Nevertheless, I was already here so I ordered an Asada, an Al Pastor, and a Carnitas Taco. Here's what I thought of the experience:

-- DESPITE PRICE, DAMN GOOD FOOD --
Though I would normally not pay $10 for 3 tacos, I have to say that they were really delicious. I especially enjoyed the Carnitas Taco, which had really flavorful, juicy, and crispy pork meat. The Asada was also juicy, but I wish it had some crisp like the Carnitas. My least favorite of the three was the Al Pastor, but even that one was okay still. Across all the tacos, I loved that they gave a healthy helping of onions, salsa, and cilantro. The fact that each one came with lime was a nice bonus too!

-- VERY FRIENDLY, EFFICIENT SERVICE -- 
One of the best features about Taqueria Castillo was the amazing service. Both the chef and the cashier were SUPER amicable. I really appreciated how courteous the cashier was. Like, he would call me "my friend." Food also came out SO FAST, which I definitely needed in order to make my volunteer shift. 

-- CHILL ATMOSPHERE, ENOUGH SEATING -- 
Though pretty basic, the restaurant was cozy for casual eating. There was enough seating between the tables and the counter. 

For the good food and better service, I give Taqueria Castillo Mission a "Nice-su, you can take your parents here and they'll be happy" rating. If only the prices were a bit lower, I'd give it a perfect review. Nevertheless, I highly encourage a visit here!

Eat well and prosper,
author: Bryan W.

description:
The little hole in the wall places are usually pretty dang good.  And this place holds true to that!

I was here for a conference (Parc 55 and Hilton) and it was within walking distance during our designated lunch hour.

My group ordered tacos and a breakfast burrito with chorizo.  I had 2 asada tacos and 1 al pastor.  Tacos were delicious and serving of meat was generous!  In hindsight, I should've just ordered 2 tacos.  My plate even came with some chips and green salsa. 

Minor complaints: place looks a little bit in disarray, limited seating, tacos are wee bit pricier than what I'm normally used to.
author: Jay Z.

description:
I have passed by this Taqueria Castillo Mexican Fast Food place for so many times in the past while riding on the 30 Stockton or the 8x... I have never thought about going to this place just to eat Burrito!!!

Until on this day on May 22nd 2018... I finally came here on my very 1st time on my dinner break from work, the day when I was here it wasn't crowded which was good for me!!! This is what... I ordered from the Taqueria Castillo which was a burrito!!! 

After finishing up a burrito for the 1st at the Taqueria Castillo... I have to say that this Mexican Place isn't that bad of a place!!! I would definitely would wanna come back to this place and try eating another item!!!

THIS IS MY YELP REVIEW #499 ONE MORE YELP REVIEW FOR #500
author: William B.

description: Fast, friendly, filling, and freakin' yummy. The breakfast burrito was a bit smaller than I thought it would be from other pictures I saw but I thought it was still worth it for 7.50.
author: Melissa S.

description:
A little pricier than I expected for Taco in the Tenderloin but I got my standard Al Pastor taco from here recently and it was pretty darn good. 

They serve it with a lemon and it was pretty flavorful. The service was very friendly as well.

The world needs a San Francisco Taco ranking...so I'm here to provide my humble list/rankings. 

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top) is my favorite/ #?  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. 

When I look at reviews sometimes just want to know where to go or how a user compares one venue against another to see if we have similar tastes. If you're curious, I have rankings for Boba, Bakeries and Ramen , Chicken and Waffles as well (random right?)  Follow my profile to see my most recent reviews.  I hope I can be helpful since so many Yelpers have helped me discover new places.

author: Rod M.

description: It was national taco day and since my husband and I are both working in San Francisco, I suggested to try this place out after reading a few reviews. The location is definitely sketch, homeless right outside the restaurant, but if you don't bother them, they won't bother you. I asked for two super tacos (al pastor, pollo con salsa verde) while my husband ordered three (carne asada, al pastor). The minimum pay for credit card I believe is $10 (?). The wait wasn't bad at all. These tacos are LOADED. The chicken one was extra messy to eat since it was covered in sauce. The cook must have heard wrong because I got a taco de asada instead of al pastor, but since my husband ordered one as well, I still got to try it. Overall, they were good, not great. They had flavor, but I think I was expecting something AMAZING based on its high ratings and what others had commented. I've definitely had better tacos. If I find myself hungry and around the area again, I'll give the burritos a chance instead of ordering the tacos again.
author: Jocelyn B.

description:
"I don't know, 'Zorro' was just so great for me because, knowing where I came from, everyone spoke Spanish to me, like, forever after that. And I'm, like, from Wales." - Catherine Zeta-Jones 

I can totally relate to Catherine and yet I never did Zorro, 'tho I do have black spandex & a black leather mask somewhere in my bottom drawer, and yes, it happens to me too, especially if I'm in the Mission District or a predominately Spanish speaking country. So, even though I took a semester of Spanish the only thing I recall was "No Hablo Español"... yet until this day I still get the "are you" look when ordering tacos...

Taqueria Castillo Mason!

On a recent Tuesday I found myself in downtown San Francisco jonesing for some tacos, but I didn't want a tourist trap and Yelp app came to my rescue. As I peruse the "tacos in downtown San Francisco" I come across a name that sounds pretty legit... Taqueria Castillo Mason, sans the Mason part as I already knew the Mason is from the street it is located on. The photos screamed legit as the workers "looked" the part, so next stop...

Taqueria Castillo Mason!

After only a couple blocks from high-end Union Square to the seedy part of town I arrive. And the exact location isn't exactly poodle friendly, yet as I walk in I enter a warm, charming & very lively taqueria! It's the typical type where you order at the counter & pay the cashier. Of course, I'm spoken to "rapidly" in Spanish, but a smile, a finger of one moment is universal, so after a few moments I order my tacos (no Tuesday taco specials, tho it's cheap enough, FYI) of Carne Asada (grilled steak) & Pollo Asada (grilled chicken). I also notice the myriad of drinks too, so I add a Pineapple Agua Fresca (fresh juice of the day) and Anchor Beer (San Francisco Brewing, since 1896). 

Taqueria Castillo Mason!

I am offered a paper plate of fresh Tortilla Chips as I wait. And after a couple minutes I am called up, of course in Spanish again, but I knew what she meant jajaja. I dig-in and enjoy the freshness of the ingredients put together by a legit Mexican Señor at the counter, and handed over to me by a legit Mexican Señora. It was delicious! And I'm sure my "Cristiano Ronaldo" Real Madrid Fútbol Jersey made them assume I was Spanish speaking too, even tho he's Portuguese, but speaks Spanish. Whatev's let's enjoy this wonderful world together! And that's your Spanish lesson for today... Te Amo;)
author: Eric R.

description:
I had the Menudo here and it was okay. I was really craving some after a long night and saw that this placed served Menudo, which I hadn't had since I was in SoCal. So, against the better judgement of everyone else getting burritos, I decided to get the menudo.

It came out quite a bit bland. They had already put the dried herbs in, and the red peppers weren't freshly crushed, it came out of those jar shaker things that you usually have at pizza places. The broth was really boring though, the flavor was really weak and I was quite disappointed in how unseasoned it was.

Usually there some rich flavor from the tripe, and its a bit spicier and heartier, but this kind of just tasted like some clear broth with some chili pepper flakes tossed in.

Overall it'll be a pass, unless I'm really craving Menudo and can't find another option in SF to have some.
author: Tyler T.

description:
I think this may be the most solid, authentic burrito you can get in the Union Square area. I'm aware that it might also be considered the Tenderloin, but from Powell Bart/Muni station to this taqueria it only takes you about 2 minutes, and I consider Powell station the Union Square area. It's kind of right where the down town / Union Square area starts to transition to the TL, if you want me to over explain it, which I always tend to do. 

Be forewarned that they are cash only, and it is indeed in a kind of sketchy area. But you're out of the sketchy area in like one block. 
I always order the super carne asada burrito, and my husband often gets the carnitas dinner plate. Both are nice hearty portions. They offer avocado opposed to guacamole on your super burrito, and have a few different salsas. Your food comes with free chips and salsa, which is starting to become unheard of in these expensive San Francisco times. The evening cashier guy is super nice and the cook is nice as well. The environment is definitely no frills, but there is plenty of space to sit and enjoy that big burrito.
author: Liz M.

description:
I love hole in the wall taco places. This one did not disappoint! 

I ordered two pastor tacos and one carne asada and pollo tacos. The service was fast and friendly. food was good quality and very hot/fresh. 

The house made horchata is fantastic! Highly recommended location!
author: Robin C.

description: I came by with a fairly large, last minute catering order. (chicken and steak tacos, 20 in total.) They individually packaged everything nicely up for me and even had a box for it all (I'm talking separate meat, tortillas, onion, cilantro, limes) They did all this in 30min!! Really nice and totally accommodating. The tacos were great and it couldn't have gone better. Muchos Gracias Taqueria Castillo Mason for making it happen so quickly!!
author: Rochelle H.

description:
This place was fine. I mean I am spoiled because I frequent food places in East Los and I personally think the best mexican food is in SD. My husband and I just wanted a hearty burrito and this place was walking distance so we walked over. 

We got a carne asada super burrito and it was fairly expensive for what it was though mostly the ingredients were good. It came with rice, avocado, beans, cheese, sour cream and onion and cilantro on the side. We got some green and orange salsa too and it was OK. Service was quick.

The area is pretty bad though, it's walkable from Union Square but I think I would've turned around if I weren't with my husband, I saw numerous homeless people and did not feel safe. Also, cash only. If you're nearby alone, stay alert!
author: Amy K.

description: I came here by accident thank god the heavens and the starts the whole universe for THE BEST DAMN SUPER NACHOS IN SF I had chicken and steak the steaks was season perfectly melted cheese fresh beans the salsa tied it all together in an explosion of flavor upon my taste buds the nacho had to be house made cause they didn't get soggy like other restaurants do definitely THE BEST SUPER NACHOS IN SF check the photos better yet for less then $12 go find out for yourself!!!!!!!! YUM!!!!!!!
author: Rolin S.

description: Found a rock when I was eating my leftover burrito from last night, the good thing is I cut it into half cause the huge size of the burrito, and I'm luckily to see the rock before I eat it..
author: Xinya Z.

description: I was in San Francisco for the day and was looking for a good Mission Style Burrito.  Castillo Mason really hit the spot.  Delicious and filling!  A hole in the wall with a sidewalk full of homeless folks to climb over at the front door, but that's the Tenderloin for you!
author: Peter G.

description: The food is pretty good, however the customer service sucks!! The guy got upset with me because I asked for a burrito with out a shell! Even though I was still paying the burrito price!I was charge extra for everything simply because he didn't not want to make my burrito with out a shell.
author: Mercedes F.

description:
Was in the area to do some shopping, but I was starving. I wanted to avoid the crappy, overpriced food in the Westfield food court and found this place on Yelp instead. 

Service here was very friendly. It really made me want to come back here in the future. I was super hungry, so I got the two mini taco place. It came with 1 chicken taco, 1 carne asada taco, and rice and beans. I decided to go with black beans for that extra protein boost, but they also have pinto and refried. I also got a small horchata and the cashier gave me packaged salsa verde. They seem stingy with their salsa since it was a choice of that or pico de gallo. They probably don't feel comfortable having a salsa bar out because of the area. 

The carne asada taco was a lot better than the chicken one! The chicken one wasn't bad, but it was a bit dry. Besides that, everything was pretty good for a hole in the wall type place. It was the perfect amount of food for me because I was really hungry! Not sure I would get the horchata again. Wasn't really fresh, in my opinion. 

This is a much better option than going to the mall. The Mexican food in the food court is plain sad and this place is cheaper, too. Also, cash only! Make sure to hit the ATM before coming here. They have one inside, but it's better to avoid the fees when there's plenty of ATMs in the surrounding area.
author: Karen R.

description: Not that great of. Neighborhood and the place has very little ventilation.  Hot inside.  Food is average.z
author: Frank D.

description: Solid taqueria between union square and the Tenderloin.  Burritos are good size and made fresh. Staff was nice too.  Loved the fact they use freshly scooped avocados  v watered down guacamole from other joints. The atmosphere is very laid back and you just go there for the food.  In terms of value it's just average.  Prices are simply the going rate for the food.  It's not expensive but not a bargain.  If you are in the area stop in and try it out.
author: Robert C.

description: By far the BEST Mexican food in the area. Under rated.. I discovered this place when my co worker mentioned it to me. Working in the area I'm always looking for new GOOD places to eat other than the horrible fast food.
author: Ale V.

description: Stopped by this place the evening of memorial day for a small dinner. I went with two pork tacos and I was certainly pleased! They were simple yet delicious. The place was practically empty but I have to imagine that has to do only with the time/day I came. Would definitely come back for more!
author: Mandie C.

description:
YEEEEEES!  I have been here enough times now to give Taqueria Castillo 5 stars.  The service and food has been awesome every time.  I get the super burrito with "regular pollo", and it's heavenly.  The super burritos are loaded with mounds of cheese, avocado, and sour cream. The portions are very generous, and the quality of the food is great.  I would highly recommend this place to lovers of fast Mexican places.  You will NEVER leave this place hungry.  The world is a better place because of Taqueria Castillo.

Thanks guys!
author: Kevin W.

description:
My boyfriend says this is the most bland Mexican food he's had in the Bay Area. I would have to sadly agree. And we had such high hopes given the existing Yelp rating! We stopped by for lunch at 1pm on a Saturday and there was maybe a couple other people in there. The guy at the cash register overcharged us, which was the first offense. Also, note that it is CASH ONLY. Their ATM charges $2.50 to take out cash. 

FOOD:

1. $8 Regular Carne Asada Burrito 
- super dry and bland 
- meat lacked seasoning 

2. $7.77 Fish Fillet Torta 
- bland overall as well
- best thing about this experience was the fish, which was cooked well 

There are free chips and salsa, but we will look elsewhere next time we're craving Mexican in Union Square.
author: Emma W.

description: Carne asada burrito tasted like burnt oil and hamburger meat and cost $11. Much better burritos in the city in much better neighborhoods. Don't go here.
author: Johnny B.

description:
Our first taco stop in SF!
Pretty decent food for the most part, but nothing too mind-blowing.
Kind of a hole in the wall place located on a street that stands in stark contrast with Market Street where you turn off, it's a small cash-only taco place where they make them there for you like any other taco place.
We got a couple beef tongue, carnitas, and pork tacos with a beef quesadilla. The quesadilla was very big and very filling, and all the food was served with fresh ingredients.. but they didn't have much -oomph- to them. They tasted pretty decent and didn't leave an imprint of amazingness, unfortunately. They also had free chips and salsa, though a bit stale.
Good food for a good price, you get what you pay for!
author: Thuan T.

description:
Craving a delicious burrito? Do not come here! 

I was wanting one delicious burrito and wanted to try a place that was walking distance from my place in lower Nob Hill. I walked a little further than I was wanting for this place, but thought I would try this place out as it was 4 stars. 

Walked in and at first didn't know what to expect. It looked a bit worn down and unkept/clean. I didn't let this bother me, again 4 stars, so thought "Hey, it'll be great! Don't judge a book by the cover" attitude. Wrong. 

My friend and I both ordered our burrito at the same time, I got a super burrito with refried beans and grilled chicken. Still, wanting that delicious burrito in mind. As I ordered, I started looking around more and of course noticed the health code score....75%?!? This had me a bit worried. Couldn't read any reasons as to why it was a lower score than I would like but I could read the date it was given, October 27th and I was in there on the 28th. Great.

As he is making the burrito, I start watching him put all the add ons and condiments on it. Avocado, he used the knife to scoop it out of the shell, but then used his fingers/hand to take it off the knife. Gross. He wasn't wearing any hair caps and looked a little sweaty from being over the grill and making the food. As he made our food, I noticed that he put the wrong beans on the wrong burritos. I ended up getting my friends pinto beans and not refried beans. Not the end of the world, but thought I would mention it. 

It was also a cash only place, so BRING CASH!!! Luckily my friend had cash, so I Venmo'd him money portion of the food.

It took about 10 minutes for the burrito to be made, a little long in my opinion. Once I got it, it was a decent sized burrito. Sat down, opened it, and it was barely warm, even though I saw him "warm it up" on the grill. At that moment, I knew it wasn't going to be that amazin burrito I was hoping for. Took a few bites and the burrito itself was falling apart, almost peeling and kind of flaky. I barely got to half of my burrito before just giving up and not eating anymore.

Definitely did not have the best experience here and do not blame them for having a 75% rating. I definitely will not be coming back to this place again in the future.
author: Michael T.

description: I was in San Fran at a conference and wanted to go to a "local" mexican restaurant, and Yelp sent me here. I brought all my friends and had high expectations based on what I read online. Unfortunately I was very disappointed. It wasn't bad food, it just wasn't good food. At $8 a plate it is hard to beat in the area, but I think next time I would be willing to spend more on better food. We didn't have to wait in line too long and the food came out quickly, but it was rather tasteless. Even adding more salt would improve it exponentially. They need more spices or something to give the food more kick. Cheap, fast, and tasteless.
author: Shelby B.

description: Awesome burritos. Vegetarian burrito is highly recommended.
author: Qasim Z.

description:
Hmm, why did we venture here for Burritos and Tacos again???  It takes a brave soul to purposefully choose this place to dine at night, but hey, we were three decent sized dudes.  Definitely a hole in wall in a place full of holes in the walls.  We ordered our food, and a dude behind the counter gave us each two to packages of salsa.  Maybe we could have had more, but every time one of asked, he seemed hesitant.  This is probably due to the types of people they get in here.  

I ordered 4 tacos, 2 carne asada and 2 lengua.  They were decently packed with meet so I have no issues with the portion size.  The carne was a little crispy, just who I like it, and were really enjoyable.  However, the lengua was extra fatty.  The first couple of bites were really good, but after that it was just too soft and mushy.  

Their burritos looked like healthy sizes as well.

Decent food, decent portions, subpar service, and horrible amenities.
author: Veasna H.

description: I've been here a few times. The super nachos with Chicken is so good!!! They finally take credit cards too, YAY!!!
author: Jane S.

description: The area is a little scary. This is at the end of the tenderloin, so watch out for that. The food is fantastic. Great burrito. If you are looking for a quick cheap burrito I would absolutely recommend this. Service was extremely kind and accommodating, especially since we showed up right as they were closing. As someone who came from San Diego, I'm always on the lookout for great burrito places and this one is now on my radar.
author: John W.

description: Very authentic Mexican street food style tacos. Super affordable prices (which is a rarity in San Francisco). The staff keeps the line moving. Only one FYI: it's cash only so come prepared.
author: Scott Z.

description: Who would of know that this would be one of my favorite Maxica restaurants ) Great costumer service, very friendly people. Family owned and on top of that great food highly  recommend.
author: Sherilyn H.

description:
Made a quick stop before heading next door to Mikkeller with two others. We actually intended on going to Taqueria Cancun but somehow walked passed and didn't want to turn back. 

When you walk inside, it looks like your standard taqueria. Cash only but only one guy working the grill - can't expect it to be like the Mission taquerias. We just got one order of nachos with al pastor and then tried to get some salsa. EXCEPT, they didn't have a salsa bar! Gasp, that was a surprise and kind of disappointing. Though, when the nachos came out, they didn't need that much more since they were covered in refried beans, cheese, al pastor, sour cream and topped with some avocado. The quantity was actually much smaller than other places though the amount of beans was more than I would have liked. In the end, it was a good option for grabbing something quick, but not a top choice if I had to choose between taquerias.
author: Liza X.

description: Grubby place.  Wash your hands upon entering and try not to step on the homeless guy laying by the entrance.  Good food though.  Got a carne Asada burrito.  Good ratio of meat to rice. Priced decent. Would definitely come back.
author: Sean C.

description:
I dream of going back to La Taqueria in the mission daily but with the early hours, its hard to get a burrito there. I've decided to try this place out since its close to work and looks like they grill the tortilla on the burrito.

Taste wise - it was just okay. Nothing spectacular. I ordered a carne asada regular burrito. The meat is kind of ground up and I personally prefer chunks of steak. The rice was also overcook and it was not wrapped very well. I would come back to try their tacos but probably no more burritos for me from here.

It's also not the nicest places to go to being in the tenderloin but its right on the edge so the walk there was not too bad.
author: Ann L.

description: Great price and good food. Value is tremendous. Wifey and I were walking by on our way back from St. Pattys day parade and she was hungry and just randomly saw the sign. Glad she did! Just good value, fill you up food. Two big burritos with chips and drinks was $25. Boom! Fire.
author: Keith M.

description: Good cabasa tacos. Dining room was very clean. Not very authentic Mexican but tasty
author: Dia Q.

description:
This burrito spot didn't win me over - it's perfectly fine but I just wasn't that impressed with the food. Maybe I've been eating too many "UK burritos!" 

It's a pretty casual place. I was there on a Saturday night and the vibe wasn't the bed - there was some dodgy folks inside and so I wasn't super comfortable, and just wanted to eat my food quicksmart. I had a chicken burrito but I just found it pretty bland, it really didn't impress me. That being said, I'd go back because Jonny Q says the prawn burrito is the one to try so maybe that's where I went wrong. 

Ok for a quick meal when you're hungry but I wouldn't go out of my way to go here.
author: Briony C.

description:
After reading many reviews on this hole in the wall, we decided to try them out for lunch during our stay at San Francisco. 

First impression wasn't the greatest. Place looks old and was kind of empty.

Menu wasn't very clear. We ordered a regular burrito with chicken and a super burrito with steak (carne asada). I would recommend anyone to get the super burrito instead of a regular since it brings guacamole and sour cream apart from everything else. Regular only brings rice, beans, cheese, and choice of meat. Chicken was a little undercooked. 

Gotta say that the size of those burritos were unique! Have to admit that they were the biggest we've ever had!
author: Amanda P.

description: I had a couple of al pastor tacos here today. They were alright, but not near the best I've had. Good for the price in the area I suppose. Good portion size for the price.
author: Clements J.

description:
so ima start with positive review ‼ thats why i gave this  two starts‼ almost 2 years ago i was pregnant and i was craving burrito i yelp this place, it has good reviews. so i went walk here to try it! this the only closest one near my work lol. anyways, i ordered a super carne asada burrito and it was good. i liked it ‼ it wasnt that bad aha


Today, i decided to try this place again‼‼ first the Lady is rude or maybe shes just like that, the cook was nice but he really rushed my food i feel like! My food was blend wasnt that good ‼ oh btw i ordered the Carne Asada again burrito ‼ like if you wanting to eat a burrito dont go here because u will just regret it and feel like you wasted your money‼ and their sauce its not that spicy its not good and the chips is so salty !! ugh this is so annoying lol
author: Lara J.

description: Stopped in for a burrito after hearing from a local was his go to Mexican joint.., wet burrito was huge and perfect ... hey the walk from Hilton was like a homeless pot gauntlet , probably flunk a drug test off second hand pot smoke, but think the food was worth it... it's a dive but inexpensive , huge amount of food, and really good.
author: Ed W.

description:
This is our go-to place for weekend morning burritos because it is so close, but it is simply sub-par compared to most of the taquerias in the Mission.

The Al Pastor is too sweet and tangy--almost tastes like barbecue sauce. The tortillas are good, but I wish they were stretchier and chewier.  Their chips are nearly flavorless.  Everything else is OK.
author: Lauren J.

description:
Decent. I forgot my lunch at home and didn't want to spend too much, so i just got 2 carne asada street tacos. Chose this place cuz when i yelped tacos, it had one of the higher health scores than the other places in the area. The meat lacked any real flavor. It was pretty average. But they give complimentary chips & salsa. Total damage, $6.10.

Located on one of the "better blocks" in the TL.
author: M P.

description: My companion and I were really hungry so we gave this place a shot even though it was dirty and looked very unwelcome. Service wasnt great and a bit confusing. At the counter, the server asked me what I wanted to order and then left the room. When he came back, he didn't acknowledge me, and then the cashier told me to go to him so he could ring up my order. While my companion thought his super burrito ($11) was tasty, it wasn't anything special and not that filling relative to a super burrito you would get elsewhere. I was super disappointed with my chicken fajitas. For $13, I got plain black beans (tasted canned), salad (chopped lettuce and tomato bits), and thin strips of chicken and bell peppers. I felt very deceived and robbed since their wasn't a lot of food on the plate, and I was still hungry. Because of the price, I thought it would have been better quality, and was expecting more meat and toppings like salsa, avocado, cheese, etc. In terms of flavor, it was super salty. I had to keep drinking water after every few bites. I wouldn't recommend this place since there are other places that offer more food at a better price point and quality.
author: Amadea M.

description: CASH ONLY! Please keep this in mind before walking in. I only had like $5 in cash and got a chicken tostada that was AMAZING. It's traditional Mexican food served by the most humble people ever.
author: Joseph M.

description:
Mmm, not sure how this place is trending at 4 stars. 

I work nearby and have been grabbing my burritos from another place nearby, but I saw that Castillo Mason had some good reviews and figured I'd give it a go. 

Like most taquerias, it's a hole in the wall. Cash only but theres an ATM on site. I ordered a regular pastor burrito which was $9 (jesus christ, San Francisco). The girl on the register was borderline rude, which I'm usually not bothered by, but when we asked for chips and salsa for two people she gave us one small bag of fairly stale chips, one small container of salsa verde and one small container of salsa fresca. 

The burrito was incredibly mediocre. The pastor was some of the worst I've had - no hint of the usual spice and signs of marination, and large chunks of chewy pork instead of small bits of crispy pork. Hard pass for me.
author: Angela L.

description: The wet burrito is all right . I went here because it was the cheapest option by the Hilton hotel. It has fast service and free chips. As you see in picture, it was only 8,75 for the burrito combo which is good
author: Han S.

description:
I've been here several times. Drunken nights, and mid day tacos. 

To me, the food here is very "okay". Tamales are microwaved and dry. Not sure if they are even house made. Burritos were also meh. Don't get me wrong it's not bad! But... very "uneventful", and I doubt any chef wants their food described that way. 

However, it's a great value for what you're getting. 2 tamales with rice beans and a "salad" plus free chips and pico for 7.50. Kick ass. 

I'll def come back whenever I'm out and about down town and in the mood for cheap Mexican food
author: Elaine S.

description:
Excellent Beef Tongue Super Taco , Chips and Salsa Bar. Excellent value for $ 3.45.
Will be back.

I am back again today. Three Tacos for Lunch
author: Food Sage W.

description: Cash only and just a couple of blocks from the Hilton.  Scary walk in tenderloin and not the cleanest in how the food is stored or handled.  But amazing tasting authentic burritos.  The salsa verde comes with the chips and is super spicy - I recommend that you pour it over your burritos.  Kids loved the chicken quesadilla.  Great value.  Loved that the drinking water is clean filtered tasting and not the tap water you normally get even at decent sit down restaurants.  It's truly a mom and pop so if pop has got people ahead of you or lots of orders then be prepared to wait.  Sweet couple though.  They also have Mexican breakfasts and bottled beer. Will definitely come again when in union square.
author: Susannah K.

description: The food was awful. The meat tasted like it's been out for 3 days and the burrito is totally tasteless. The only good thing was the nachos. Would recommend going somewhere else in the area. Literally any other place.
author: Razvan B.

description: Visiting from Southern California.....craving some tacos. We were staying in the area and found this spot. I had the Tacos al Pastor and they were fantastic! The guys working were awesome! My husband and daughter loved the Carne Asada Qusadillas and my other daughter really enjoyed the Mini Taco plate! We may even come back again before our trip ends.
author: Michelle J.

description:
Good: this place serves home made authentic Mexican cuisine. You can select from most of the traditional meats and sauces that you would expect plus additional chickens, chorizo and tripe. I had guacamole with chips and a wet chicken burrito. The guac was delicious, but a little thin for me. I think they mix it with some verde salsa. The burrito was above average and it was served covered in sauce and guac which was perfect for me. About the size of a Qdoba burrito. 

Service: there isn't too much to say here. You order at the counter and they bring you your food when it's ready. Polite enough.

Atmosphere: looks like a hole in the wall and I'm surprised I actually went there, but some locals convinced me to avoid the tourist traps. 

I'd go back if in the area and looking for Mexican, but this place is a little authentic for me. I tend to prefer more American Mexican if that makes sense. Of course San Fran has lots of great places to select from as well so we shall see. Thanks again for an enjoyable meal.
author: Ryan K.

description:
When I see tourists wander onto the first block of Mason, I have to admit I feel sorry for them because they will inevitably get the full frontal Tenderloin experience here. It's not for everyone unless you're hustling to get to Mikkeller or Farmerbrown the hard way. Me? I was just looking for another place to get menudo on the weekend, and I found it (photo: http://bit.ly/1cUGWcz). I assume it's related to the Taqueria Castillo on McAllister since they look similar, but I have to say that service here is more on the surly side. It's really no wonder as there was a strange, bedraggled woman eating a barbecue turkey leg with no intention of ordering anything they made. She just kept standing there letting the greasy drippings land on the worn linoleum indifferent to those of us waiting to order.

Welcome to the Tenderloin. At least I could look at the colorful murals that covered the walls (photo: http://bit.ly/1j2E4PI). I particularly like the couple dancing up a storm somewhere in the Sonora desert, she in white high heels that must have been a bitch to clean afterward (photo: http://bit.ly/1lTvC5e). Oh, it's my turn now. The $9.50 bowl of Menudo...to go, por favor. Yeah, I ain't staying in there. Not sure when the next turkey leg will come in. Regardless, the menudo was pretty good (photo: http://bit.ly/1lTw2J1), about the same in quality as the other Taqueria Castillo with the requisite tortillas in one foil pouch an the lemon wedge, chopped onions and oregano flakes in the other. Nothing noteworthy in the execution, but it still hit the spot when I got it home. I love this stuff.

FOOD - 3 stars...passably decent bowl of menudo, will likely go to the Mission the next time
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...4 stars for the wall art but all else is...well...
SERVICE - 2.5 stars...like I said, surly
TOTAL - 3 stars...menudo in the 'Loin...it's an option, I guess
author: Ed U.

description:
I had this place bookmarked for a long time on Yelp.  It's not even that far from my home, but I just did not have time to seek it out until now.  I feel like the food here is authentic with a nice selection of burritos, tacos, taquitos, flautas, even including menudo.  I ordered a regular chicken burrito with a citrus fresca drink.  Prices are really reasonable!  

If you don't like your food spicy, ask for it without jalapenos as it was peppered here and there in my burrito.  I was mostly ok with it, but I was sweating a bit!  The salsa they provide in small plastic containers with the chips by the cash register also has a lot of jalapenos.  

Admittedly, my friend and I felt quite sleepy and out of it after all the good beans and rice in our burritos, but it was well worth it.  Between the tasty food and the reasonable prices, I will definitely come back!  I will have a few less jalapenos and will make time for a good nap afterwards next time though.
author: Maile N.

description:
Cheap AF! Especially a good value to line your stomach before going out on Polk Street, both of which I did this weekend. I would probably go back if I lived in the area, but I can't say I'm positive I'd go back. I ordered 2 chicken tacos, and the process to order was super confusing, and resulted in me accidentally kidnapping someone else's tacos before mine were ready. I returned their tacos after I realized they were steak and not chicken, and got my tacos shortly after.

I should have gotten the super tacos so my b, and my chicken tacos weren't bad, just not what I expected. The chicken was kind of dry, yet super greasy at the same time with odd shrively burned pieces, I also wish there was more indication on what sauces were available for me to put on my tacos cause I think I saw pico and a few types of salsa but had no idea what it was. This would have drastically improved my tacos, but as I said they were totally passable, just did not live up to my expectations. All in all kind of a bummer, as I am a big fan of hole in the wall Mexican spots.
author: Julia E.

description: Fresh, tasty, cheap Mexican food.
author: Roma T.

description: This was my first time here, & probably my last... I ordered the mini taco plate, & the taco themselves were pretty good. The rice that came along wasn't fresh, on the soggier side,  & the beans were fine. The chips were free & decent, but there were only two types of salsas available: pico de gallo & verde. The pico de gallo tasted homemade & was decent as well. I've been to a handful of taquerias, but this one was definitely my least favorite.
author: Jade L.

description: Down and dirty taco spot. Really cheap spot to grab a quick, flavorful lunch. The line was long when we visited so you knew they were doing something right. I opted for the two taco platter, my carne asada meat was really well seasoned and then the chicken with salsa verde was really good too. The taco platter which was two tacos, plus rice, and beans came out to $8.50, well worth it. The tacos came fully loaded with salsa, lettuce, tomatoes, creme fresca, etc. They are quick moving so you can be in and out for lunch. They serve up complimentary chips and salsa as well. Easy spot to pop in for a solid lunch.
author: Alicia C.

description:
This place is close to my work and I always love me some Mexican food. Even though i only get burritos here, the burritos are excellent. The employees are nice and they've always treated me kindly.

It's affordably priced food with great portions.
author: Zachary H.

description: Wow i ordered the pork loaded taco and it blew my expectation! It was soooo good. I didn't know what to expect.. given the neighborhood was pretty sketchy, the place was empty when we walked in, the place was pretty dirty. But the pork taco was filled was so much meat and toppings! The guys were so nice. And the green verde was soooo good! 5 stars for the food, but it lost a star for the dirty restaurant and street was filled with bums.
author: Joling S.

description:
Had dinner here tonight and usually the holes in the walls, typically have the best food.  Well, this is definitely a hole in the wall and the food is decent, but I've definitely had better.  

They got my order wrong, even though I pointed at it.  Not bad, but I wouldn't go back. I can get average Mexican good any where, if mediocre food is all it has to offer, I'd rather have mediocre food at a nice restaurant with better atmosphere.
author: Greg W.

description: Found it based off reviews. Carne Asada was awesome!! So much flavor and extremely juicy. I got the super burrito and they were very generous with the avocado. They did not have housemade chips or salsa which is why I only gave 4 stars. Based off burrito only they get 5 stars and would definitely go back and recommend!!
author: Travis M.

description:
Carnitas....I'm in love. It's as close to Mexican food from the border that you can get that doesn't involve hipsters and lines a la Mission. 

The owner said they'd been open for 7 years...I've lived here longer than that and how I didn't know about them made me mad at myself as I've walked by it on my way to Mikkeller a bunch of times. Only so many people come here because of the location and that it looks like a hole-in-the-wall.

Which, it is one that seriously makes some damn good food. The enchiladas were perfect and the tacos were super fresh. Ambiance is very typical of most taquerias in San Diego, no frills, a little boring, but who cares when it's all about the food!? The dudes who run it are awesome and very nice, spend 20 minutes eating there and you'll see a string of locals who know the guys coming in to eat or grab take out.

Oh, also, they deliver on Eat24 - heaven!
author: Alita M.

description:
You know, there are still people in this world doing God's work, right? Bricklayers and stonemasons, line cooks and the man who used to make pancakes at Chuck's in Stockton, Bicycle Messangers and Bus Drivers (especially bus drivers). They (we) don't hold a candle to the taqueros working this tenderloin based taco shop on Sunday nights.

Why? Well, God likes burritos (duh). Also, these guys get wrung through the wringer by the denezins of the Loin, spending their nights in a yellow-painted bunker while assholes, wayward tourists, and drunken tech bros scream at them. Yet, they still manage to make a pretty good plate of Mexican food quickly, competently, and with a smile.

The Burritos (6.79 for a standard, 9.01 for super) are decent to above average. Although I loved the perfectly griddled flour tortilla, well-melted cheese, and hearty bean and rice combination, the ingredient mix and overall temperature weren't optimal, with sour cream and guacamole segregation bringing down slab-wide temperatures, however, the guacamole was provided in quantity. Meats range from fair (the chicken in chile verde was a little on the tough, stringy side) to very good ( an onion-touched crispy pastor and tender cabeza are standouts). Ask for spicy and you'll get it.

Chips are free, beer and wine available. Cash only! Free entertainiment in the form of a lone, sad television and live Tenderloin Drama.

3.5 stars rounded up.
author: Casey U.

description: Ordered a chorizo torta. Took a while, but I didn't mind because that meant it would be nice and hot when I got it. Chorizo was nice, good amount of guacamole in there too. I liked that the cheese was baked onto the bread. However, that same bread is hard and dry. It ruined the sandwich. There are a lot of other better restaurants to try before going here. I only went here because Tropi Sueno was closed anyways.
author: Tracy S.

description:
2 super tacos and 1 super burrito = $13 ish = SUPER stuffed stomachs. Those super tacos are definitely piled high with deliciousness. They don't skimp. After one of those tacos each, my husband and I could only share half of the burrito. 

Cash only, which kind of sucks. But decent place that I would love to regularly come back to.
author: Kelly G.

description:
Really good, and really filling.

I had the Super Burrito, which was massive and tasty.  The tortilla was very fresh, and had an almost flaky-type quality to it.  It was packed full of chicken, seasoned rice, black beans, ripe avocado, sour cream and salsa.  $8, and I probably could have made two meals out of it.  

Jarritos to drink, and free (very fresh) chips and salsa while you wait, which in my case wasn't long.  

Cash only.  Ambiance is BYO.  Would definitely return.
author: Scott H.

description: Hole in the wall taco shop that also have burritos, quesadillas and much more. The al pastor tacos are tasty. Order a super taco to get all the fixings, including a half avocado on each taco!
author: Karen B.

description:
Service is good, very friendly staff.  Chips and salsa is free and comes with your meal which is a plus.  I had the super nachos with carne asada.  It's a little pricey ~10$, but the portion is pretty big so I guess that makes up for it.  They don't use nacho cheese which was disappointing, they use real cheese.  There's no guacomole but they have freshly sliced avocado.  There's a lot of meat and chips.  But overall, the nachos is OK, I've had better.
My gf had the super tacos, one carne asada and one al pastor.  They are pretty big and loaded with meat, pretty filling actually and reasonable for the price.  The tacos were really good and very surprising.  I'd rather get these than the nachos.  Please note that you should eat all your food or else the homeless guy will come in and ask for it!  We decided to give my left over nachos to the homeless guy.  We would come back again!
author: Kevin N.

description:
This place was probably the best thing that happened to me after hanging around at a rooftop lounge. We were starving and wanted food right away. You can imagine, on Friday nights, the waits are always over 45 minutes long so this was really hard. Either way, we spent around $11.00 for nachos. At first, I thought this was overly priced for a small hole in the wall place. 

The nachos were made right in front of me with the ingredients that I wanted. Fresh and LARGE IN QUANTITY. The dish was shared between two people but even then we had problems finishing the whole thing. Aghhhh, it was SO GOOD! I cannot wait to come back to this place and try some of their burritos. Happy eating everyone, you won't regret it :)

Only wish this place accepted credit cards...
author: Sonam S.

description:
It's safe to say this place is a hidden gem, and wow I'm glad I found it!

While the location and outside ambiance are grim, the food definitely makes up for it. I had a chicken (regular) & cheese quesadilla, and this goes down as one of my favorite.

The "regular" chicken - so juicy and delicious. Imagine chicken marinated in chicken noodle soup. Hands down amazing. Get it over the grilled chicken. The tortilla was perfectly toasted, and portion size was huge.

This place is inexpensive, but also it's cash only. Don't catch yourself off guard.

So the food was by far delicious, but I am docking a star for the following:
- Dreary Location, homeless sitting outside
- No bathroom/hand sanitizer. I badly wanted to wash my hands from the outside
- A bit messy to eat. The juices were oozing (again making me want to wash my hands)

Overall, I'll be back!
author: Dylan R.

description:
Amazing food! We were pleasantly surprised to find this hole in the wall while shopping. 

I had a burrito and was shocked by the size of the burrito. It was huge! I couldn't finish it but I don't think that is ever really considered a bad thing. Beyond the size, it was delicious! I highly recommend it, especially the salsa verde. 

My boyfriend had pastor tacos and he says "it was pretty d*mn good". 

The staff was also extremely friendly, which always makes me happy!
author: Carissa B.

description:
Great menu available all day long (from 8 AM to 10 PM). So if your Saturday Night was so hard that you woke up at 4PM, for sure you will go here and let their "huevos rancheros" to combat your hangover. 
Best staff possible: nice and eficient. The restaurant was clean and had a good atmosphere for both travelers and locals. Ah! And don't forge to check the beer selection, you will find the perfect companion for your meal.
author: Blanca L.

description: I enjoy this place. Staff is always super friendly and the food is good. I rate it four stars because I feel the people there are great and the price is ok
author: Tha C.

description:
Accessibility (Parking / Wait Time)

0/1 Star: I walked there but parking looks hard to find. 10 minute wait to order. 

_____

Service (Waiter / Cleanness / Ambiance)

0/1 Star: cafeteria style service. Small hole in the wall.

_____

Taste (0=Not Edible / 1=Edible / 2=Good (average) / 3=Must Try!)

3/3 Stars: the food here is a must try! Everything was done right. Meat is freshly grilled and goes into your burrito hot and juicy!  

_____

Overall Experience

3/5 Stars 

_____

Last Words
Great hole in the wall food!
author: Elliott N.

description: Not bad, not bad at all. They definetly have the flavors, and can't beat the price either. Excellent for a quick stop when you are in a hurry and need a solid, tasty meal that won't leave you broke.
author: Daniel A.

description: My husband and I were not impressed. We found this place via Yelp, and were excited to get some Mexican. Cash only btw! We split a carne supreme burrito since they looked huge, and vegetarian nachos. Both were very lackluster in flavor we were drowning our meals in hot sauce. The carne was very chewy. Maybe it was an off day. Nice staff.
author: Stephy S.

description:
FRESH ingredients...GENUINE smiles...FAST, professional service.  I'm always amazed at the amount of food I get for a reasonable price.

I get the carne asada plate, with double meat, which feeds me and my dog TWICE for less than $15, and they have amazing burritos for under $10.

They only accept cash, but there's an ATM inside.
author: Matt T.

description: This little hole in the wall was a pleasant surprise.  The food was great,  one of the best burritos we had had in some time. The super bowl nachos were fabulous.  This place should be standing room only. It is not on market it is behind it on Mason. Big portions
author: Kellyanna M.

description:
A typical experience at Taqueria Castillo Mason:

*Grab a few dolla bills 
*Order their carnitas quesadilla (once you go carnitas you'll never go back) 
*Throw those dolla bills in their faces cause this place is cash only
*Grab a bunch of napkins
*Wolf their humongous, delicious quesadilla down 
*Feel no guilt whatsoever 
*Use your napkins to wipe away all that grease and oil from your now stain covered shirt 
*Feel no guilty whatsoever again 
*Walk away like a boss cause you've just fed yourself for the entire day
author: Peter Y.

description:
The prices and flavors are phenomenal.  Stopped by today after my flight from Honolulu and munched down on the pastor super-tacos.  Hawaii's got their culinary strong suits but Mexican food is definitely not one of them.  Castillo filled the void nicely.  It's good to be back.

A funny side note, I placed my order with the guy at the counter first instead of the person cooking.  Probably should have done that in reverse order.  Counter guy relayed the order to the cook but it was sort of lost in the shuffle of orders and people.  After waiting around I asked the counter guy about it, and he repeated it to the cook.  She then said something in Spanish that sounded suspiciously like "That chinito didn't tell me nothing".  Just a heads up to the good people of Taqueria Castillo Mason:  I'm not offended, and I had a good laugh even if that's not what she said.  If she did indeed say it though, keep in mind this is California.  Even the white people have some sort of grasp of Espanol.  If you're going to throw shade on the low, you guys are going to have to pick a more obscure language.
author: Alex S.

description: Hole in the wall place with super fast service. Free chips and salsa to go with your tacos and burrittos. Can you ask for anything more? :)
author: Nitish S.

description:
If you want something that's filling this is the place to go to. If you want something tasty this place was average at best. Keep in mind this is a home style taqueria so everything tastes like you had made it yourself so nothing special but for the price and the quantity you can't beat it.

It is also cash only so make sure you take cash!!
author: Vee P.

description: Cheap, good, TASTY Mexican food. Go here if you're looking for some food in the city, it's not too far from anywhere. Keep in mind they only accept cash, but there's an atm inside the restaurant.
author: Shruti M.

description: My first Bay Area burrito. I had the chicken super with all the fixings.  The chicken was cooked in front of me, but it still tasted old. Everything else was fresh and tasty. The super size was a bit smaller than I expected.
author: Joshua B.

description: Just flew into SF from Texas and needed a quick bite to hold me over Til dinner.  The tacos were incredible. I was asked if I wanted a regular taco or super and of course went Super and it was delicious.
author: Lynda D.

description:
If the truth be known, If anyone wants to kill me - a poisoned burrito could well be the best way to go about it. Even back in the UK I eat a couple a week and it's always with great anticipation that I come to California and get as fat on 'south of the border' delights as I can. 

So this place is pretty much as rustic as you get. It was full of Mexicans huddled around the football match which is obviously a good sign and it's a place to settle in and hangout or simply take it away. A really good selection of burritos and tacos is available with me going for the super sized and super tasty prawn burrito ($10)

Now I'm not in the habit of leaving a burrito but if any one meal was going to get me to contemplate it, it was this whopper. Layered with tasty cheese, sour cream, guac and with a choice of wraps (tomato, spinach and plain) I reckon I could keep coming back and try something new every day. They also give away free nachos, guac pots and tap water on a counter. 

You can tell this place was properly authentic by the range of meats they do. Offal and tongue burritos and taco's were also on the menu but for me it's all about the seafood - you just don't get much seafood Mexican back in the UK. 

Overall this was freaking amazing. In fact it nicely lined my stomach for a few pints in the Mikkeller bar next door afterwards. Based on this burrito, if it was my last meal then it would be a good way to go (sorry about being so morbid today...)
author: Jonny Q.

description: My question is this, why is it so hard to get a good burrito outside of the Mission? This place is average at best....food is bland, simple, nothing special. If you're a tourist, chances are you will love this place because Mexican food in your home area probably sucks. But locals should not settle for mediocre Mexican food.
author: Javi M.

description:
Fish Taco and Vegetarian Taco review:

To the point: generous tacos for the price. $2.57 for regular (salsa, onion, cilantro) and $3.31 for super - cheese, FRESH AVOCADO, and the other goodies 


Fish taco had a huge white fish fillet. Grilled with seasoning. It's on top of two corn tortillas that have melted jack cheese. Fresh avocado slices on top. I liked it so much yesterday I came back for it today. 

Vegetarian has whole pinto beans, rice and avocado plus lettuce, melted cheese on the tortilla. Also a huge taco, and not because it has a fistful of lettuce on it - it has lots of beans and rice, but no grilled veggies (if you are looking for a vegetable taco). I loved this taco anyway! 

Incredibly friendly people working the mom and pop joint with yellow walls and murals depicting random mission corridors with turkeys in the hallway. 

Big jugs of agua fresca - looks like horchata and tamarind 

Lots of bottled beers and drinks. Awesome containers of green salsas and salsa fresca to take with you, and freh radish too. 

Five stars for having some righteous tacos. I actually prefer this fish taco to Garaje's, and Garaje's is the law in my house. The grilled chicken and carne Asada looked legit but I haven't tried it. They also had pork belly which I haven't dug into yet either.  

My friend lives right next door and I drop my dog off there everyday. I see myself eating my way through their menu. They have some awesome looking breakfast items (huevos rancheros)
author: Jacqueline O.

description:
Pretty decent Mex food.  I got the Lengua & the Carnitas super taco.  

Lengua was great!  Carnitas was greasy (like greasier than typical greasy Mexican), but making it a "super" taco, was a great idea!!

Yummm
author: CatwomanRoar M.

description: nice staff, but food was not very good in my opinion. I tried the chicken and fish tacos. the chicken felt like it was over fried and dry, which really took away from the flavor of the taco.
author: Sasha G.

description: Very very tasty food. That's all that matters! Try the super taco with Al Pastor. Of course, very affordable.
author: Aashish R.

description: Excellent food. My favorite is either of the quesadillas with carne asada (one has added toppings, like jalapeños, avocado, sour cream, etc.). Their vegetarian burrito is also delicious. My partner loves the salsa-verde-marinated chicken. I'm more of a carne or vege man myself. Either way, you can't go wrong here. NOTE: cash only (with an ATM inside) so have cash ready.
author: Samuel F.

description: For $5.50 got a really great 'super taco' and a drink. Taco was piled high and came with a spare to mop up the juices. Definitely one to go to. Nice decor and very clean for a local joint!
author: Nathan M.

description: 3 stars bcoz the tacos were good. we also tried the quesadilla which is just ok, eatable. But I have tried better ones in SF only. I dont think I would be going there again unless no other places are open
author: Riya G.

description: I had the mini taco plate. Comes with two tacos, rice and beans. I had the beef tacos, and they piled up the beef. You also get a small tray of chips and either pico de gallo or tomatillo sauce. I had the pico and it was good, looked freshly made. Will eat here again!
author: Keith S.

description:
what a surprise!  The food is good.  The workers are friendly -- just give them a smile first to break the ice...and they warmed up.

I had a super burrito with carne asada-  tasty.

FYI:  It is CASH only, but there is an ATM machine inside if you forget.  It has a $2.50 transaction fee.
author: Al O.

description:
This place sucked. We came in on a Saturday night at around 9pm after doing some shopping at Westfield. The employees were already "cleaning" the restaurant and they seemed to loathe our very existence upon noticing our arrival which constituted a whopping three adults and a 7 year old boy. The guy wouldn't even say "Hi", "How are you guys?", "Go outside and play in traffic", or anything to that effect. He would simply give us his best thousand yard stare. 

The wifey decided to order some carne asada nachos. Thousand yard stare man plops the dish of nachos and cheese in the microwave, for his audience to see. I could understand if he is the owner or manager and has already mailed it in as far as his passion for the job is concerned, but wouldn't he rather have the microwave away from everyone, in the kitchen, to at least give the impression that he gives a damn about his culinary abilities? The food was bland and flavorless, and the employees' hygiene looked questionable at best. 

I just shake my head when people say that this place has good Mexican food. None of the inconsequential souls who man this place would have a clue as to what Mexican food should taste like even if they got smacked with 10,000 pounds of jalapenos in their ugly caras. Will not come back.
author: Alvaro F.

description: Nice place with friendly people. Dropped in for lunch and for a very affordable price a tasty burrito was prepared. Was sceptical at first being so close to union square but this little hole in the wall is a really good place for Mexican food.
author: Adrian K.

description: OK - Really not worth it to order the Nachos.  Expensive for just nachos and the big problem is that they Microwave them to warm them up & melt the cheese.  Good nachos are baked so that the chips stay crispy.  These ended up in on big, wet, sloppy mess.  I might try the taqueria again but definitely would not order the nachos.
author: Jon W.

description: Mehhh.. I've had better burritos. Tropisueno even though seems a little more fancier is in the same price bracket, they accept credit cards and have an awesome salsa bar for free. I had a veggie burrito bowl, the cheese on it was ewwww.. the pico de gallo did not seem fresh. The chips tasted weird. I don't think i'd go there again.
author: Ram S.

description: Excellent tacos - flavorful (carnitas and pastor are superb). Size and price make them even more excellent. Have a beer at mikkeler next door and then come here for the tacos. Looks a bit dicey, but totally worth it.
author: Rajarshi G.

description: Really fresh and simple tacos with amazing flavor!  Friendly staff, albeit quite, staff.  CASH ONLY.
author: Josh W.

description: Taqueria Castillo Mason was a pleasant, unexpected surprise on my trip to San Francisco.  Despite the, well, questionable people in the area and old building, this is an excellent choice for some quality Mexican food in the neighborhood.  I had the enchilada plate and my friend had the tamale plate, both of which were fantastic and filling.  There is also ample seating indoors if you are looking to escape the SF rain/cold and have a warm meal inside.  If I was in the area again, I would definitely return for more.
author: Bryce M.

description:
Burrito was huge! They don't scrimp on anything, and i was full by the time i had half of it. Prawn and fish was fresh and flavourful, and avocados given were ripe to perfection. That's saying something as i am usually very particular about this favourite fruit/vege of mine :) 

$18 for literally 2 meals and a jarritos. The only downside is that they only accept cash, but an atm is just beside the counter should you need it. The staff were super warm, friendly and helpful. Overall i am missing this piece of heaven i had on my last day in sf.
author: Lim F.

description: Solid no frills, no thrills taco joint with free chips and salsa. If you're in the area looking for a quick taco fix, definitely check this place out! Cash only, though...
author: Stephanie S.

description: It was okay, nothing spectacular. I got a carne asada burrito and it filled me up but nothing to write home about
author: Billy F.

description: I wish I had just gone to Chipotle. The burrito was bland, the beef was full of fat and gristle and the 'spicy' salsa was just tangy. Normally getting a mouthful of fat is enough to kill my appetite but I was starving so I picked through it as best I could. There was not much actual meat left when I was done. Disappointing.
author: Samantha P.

description: Perfectly priced. Delicious authentic Mexican food. Great bang for your buck. The veggie burrito was enormous and filling! No lard in the refried beans which is something I am always careful about. I would go back in a heartbeat. Yum.
author: Irene C.

description:
WOW!

This may well have been the best burrito I've ever eaten. I had a super burrito with pork, no beans, and half rice. I told the cook ONCE what I wanted and it was prepared exactly as ordered. Fantastic service.

There's no need to worry about small portions. Even without beans and half the rice, this thing is enormous!

Like everybody else said, it's cash only.

The ingredients are very fresh, and there's an excellent selection.

It's definitely a hole in the wall, it's very easy to miss, and the decor is simple. It's half a block north of Market and a block west of the tourists.

Highly recommended!
author: Phil M.

description:
The super taco was huge and filing and delicious. Chicken was well cooked and very flavorful. And only $3.50 or so.  

Our bill for two was $13.09 with drinks. 

Why do I always seem to find the best places on the final night of my vacations?  

Only bad part is I might obsess over this place til I can get back. Why go anywhere else?
author: J J.

description: The food tastes fresh - the salsa verde is right on.  It's home style and I say go if you're into that. I spent 14.00 on nachos and a Coke I wouldn't necessarily do that again - But it's a quaint place.
author: mandeep M.

description: I also forgot to add to ask for the complementary salsas. Make sure to get both of the sauces. Then apply the salsa to whatever you order and it will take your meal to the next.
author: Donald G.

description: not bad at all. nothing crazy or unexpected, but that's kinda the point. the chicken burrito was excellent chips were fresh. i'd stop here anytime I'm craving some quick mexican.
author: Jordan G.

description:
This is what a burrito should be. $9 for a super burrito, a tad pricey for my wanting, BUT was definitely worth every bite.You are paying for quality and there's nothing about the burrito that tastes cheap or fake.

I got the carnitas super burrito and it was loaded with meat and goodness. It was the best burrito I've had outside of the mission in a while. The meat really made it outstanding. It was such a tasty burrito. The sauces are also great! I loved that the place was simple and to the point. 

The men behind the counter were very friendly. They had a TV in there and it was pretty empty, but clean and nice. If I'm ever in the area and hungry for a burrito, there's no competition around.

Cash only!
author: Junel S.

description:
Possibly wold have given Castillo a 5 star IF this event did not occur as I was eating my superb burrito...

It's 5:30 pm on a nice Thursday night in the heart of the Tenderloin. My white ass is grubbin' out on my $5.35 carne asade burrito when all of a sudden I hear, "POP, POP, POP!!!!!!!" ....... Wtf??? It's October, those were not fireworks and that was loud as SHIT! Within seconds I see people running down to Turk Block in bundles. A shooting you say??? YES!!! I walk down to Turk with my burrito in hand to discover 2 people curbside bleeding out.. WTF!!!!!!!!!!

Week and a half later.... I'm craving good Mexican food, where to go?? CASTILLO'S!!! NO, you don't want to get hit by a stray bullet.. End up going of course cause.... I dont know?? Anyway, on this occasion when I 1st walk in there is a dude lying down face first on the ground with a taco in hand... Ask dude if he's okay, no response of course... Eh, 2 or 3  40 oz's too much, let the guy have drunk dreams about pollo asado tacos.

WOW TENDERLOIN, JUST WOW.....

On a positive note, Castillo offers authentic Mexican food, chips nd salsa bar, groovy musica and friendly customer service. You've been warned on the location though, hopefully.
author: Patrick O.

description: The food was plentiful for the price, the ingredients fresh, and the people were friendly. I had two beef tacos to go but they smelled so good I ate them there. Definitely an out of the way place and so close to my hotel. I'll be back.
author: B B.

description: The real deal. Pridefully managed.  Clean, fresh, not fancy but and incredible value.  Fresh salsas and a good selection.   The mini taco plate with spicy chicken is excellent.  And, they serve beer.
author: Erik W.

description:
Better than 3 stars, but its nothing craze-worthy. In short, a great burrito for cheap in a small mexican kitchen.

Yeah, the place is pretty small and dingy. But that's how you know the food is great! I have only ordered the regular burrito for $6 but it was a damn good burrito. Fast, as you would expect, and you get chips and salsa included! YAY! 

But it is cash only.
And there was definitely a guy smoking crack outside the doorway, not even trying to conceal it. 
So I'll only go back when my friends come with me, cause the street it is on is sketch as F!!!!!!!!!!
author: Kevin S.

description:
The address here says Union Square area, but trust me, it's not touristy. It's in the Tenderloin. Not the roughest part, but you do get some grimey looking people around. 

The food however is top notch. One of the best burrito joints in the Bay Area and I've been to a few. 

The Super Burrito is huge and stuffed with everything needed to satisfy your hunger. Even the Vegetarian Super is delicisous.

The Tortas are a good alternative too if you don't want something different. The meat kind of falls out if you're not careful but overall very tasty!

Word of warning though. If you get the tall hefty guy making your order, he gets his beans confused. Ordering Pinto gets you refried. Ordering Black gets you Pinto. Just keep reminding him. Be ready to stop him if he reaches for the wrong beans!
author: Johnny D.

description:
Good food, but nothing to get excited about.  Definitely  a hole in the wall.  Prices are reasonable & Cash only.

Pork in the burrito was juicy and tasty.  However, when I opened up the burrito the wrapper stuck to the tortilla creating a HUGE tear in the burrito.

Best to order to go, but you risk opening your food only to discover it is not what you ordered.  We made the mistake and ate at  the reataurant.......wobbly dirty tables.

Chips were definately not made in house.......most likely from a bag from the local market or Costco.

Okay if looking to fill your stomache with average tasting Mexican food.
author: TR W.

description:
This was a pretty solid lunch for me and two friends as we toured around union square.  It's definitely a hole-in-the-wall (cash only, no AC), but the food was delicious!  We had the burrito with steak, huevos con chorizo, and the wet burrito.  The servings are HUGE and the flavors are great.  I could only eat half of my steak burrito.  I only wish we could have taken our leftovers with us, but we had a long day of tourist-y behavior ahead of us and alas, couldn't.  

One kind of weird thing about this place: when you're done, there isn't a trash can or anything to throw your trash and stuff in; you just put it in a bus tub full of other peoples' trash and partially-eaten food.  Kind of off-putting for me.
author: Rinn H.

description: We were hungry and it was hot and they had beer. I would go there again tough. Reasonable prices and generous portions. Quesadillas were forgetful.
author: Junica B.

description: Ordered fish tacos, that weren't on the menu, from the friendly chef, and was tempted into buying on a refreshing pineapple juice to go along with it. The friendly cashier also let us sample the horchata, which is not my cup of tea. The tacos were so overloaded with fish and ingredients that I split each taco into two mini tacos (with the two tortillas that come with each taco) and each mini taco was still overflowing with ingredients. Standard white fish, but yummy nevertheless. I love me a good taqueria!
author: Nat W.

description: I've been here twice. It's definitely the spot to go when you just want a quick bite at a reasonable price. It's reasonably good quality for the price. The only reason I'm rating it 4 stars is because the first time I came my burrito tasted like fish (was cooked right before by order).
author: Noel A.

description:
Went here on my lunch break after reading another Yelp review, and absolutely loved it!! Cute little treasure tucked away in downtown SF. Food is prepped to order, fast service, friendly staff, and, most importantly, damn good food!! I will be back! 

PS, cash only but they have an ATM. Come with your cash and come prepared to enjoy yourself!
author: Jordan A.

description: The regular burrito is awesome! My friend and I got the carne asada and the pastor and both were great! Definitely use the green sauce they have at the salsa bar. The staff were super friendly too. Highly recommend if you hang around Union Square area!
author: Louisa M.

description: Delicious tacos! Great flavors, don't skimp on avocado and made to order. Not to mention the fast and friendly service. LOVE this place :) I strongly recommend the super taco... two usually fill me up and only cost about $7 together!
author: P A.

description:
Craving a breakfast burrito while staying in Union Square, I sent my husband out to get me a chorizo and eggs burrito.  I specified potatoes in it and no onions.  He comes back with a really dry burrito with chorizo, rice, and onions.  wth?  No eggs whatsoever.

I sent my husband back to get it fixed, and he told them what to put in the burrito, and they didn't have potatoes.  =(  So my burrito only had chorizo and eggs in it, which would be ok, but their chorizo was really dry, with no flavor.  The tortillas weren't even good. I don't know how people are reviewing this as the best mexican food in SF.  Are you kidding me?
author: Vi Y.

description: This used to be my go to place in sf when I worked there.. Good people. Al pastor is okay. Carne as asada is great
author: Armando C.

description:
I am not sure how they did it.  

I was in a local bar and watched some patrons eating burritos and they devoured them.  Moments later I watched as the staff (drunk staff) started chowing on the same burrito!  I asked them (drunk yelper) where can I get said same burrito?!?

Venture past the homeless and crack dealers to find your answer.

I will tell you...  One of the greatest burritos I have ever had in my life....
author: Dean P.

description:
Some of the best Mexican food I've had in SF. The Alambre was excellent, thick and flavorful bacon chunks, tasty peppers and fresh avocado slices. 

Amazingly friendly staff and ridiculously reasonable prices.
author: Mike J.

description: Best taqueria that is walking distance from my office. Solid burritos that are priced well and the cashier is super nice, I always leave with a smile.
author: Christine K.

description:
This is a decent taqueria.  I had a carne asada super burrito with black beans and everything else. The size was good- your typical super burrito size. I liked that they put fresh avocado in there, which not every place does. But the meat wasn't all that great - I pulled out several large chunks of gristle - yuck! So that's why this place only gets 4 starts. 

On a side note, their avocado green salsa is delicious with a nice bite.

The inside is pretty clean and there are several tables to sit at.  I got mine to go though.
author: Mike F.

description: We were shopping downtown today, two o'clock had passed by, and I hadn't eaten lunch yet. Always a dangerous situation as anyone who knows me can attest! I looked on Yelp for a quick bite to eat in the area and Taqueria Castillo is what I hit on. I was pleasantly surprised by the vegetarian tacos I ordered. It's easy to make a very bland veggie taco since you don't have any seasoned meat to go in it. The key is a good amount of melted cheese and tasty salsa to go on top. They got both right! In fact, their tomatillo salsa was really impressively delicious, I'd come back just for that.
author: Lindsey B.

description: Quick service, reasonably priced, but the chicken burrito wasn't up to taqueria par.  Specifically the grilled chicken was chewy like rubber, not chicken-y.
author: J T.

description:
Just had my second round here at Castillo Mason, and I'm a pretty big fan. If you're looking for a fresh, cheap, HUGE freaking burrito, you've found the right place.

Major brownie points for pillow-sized dollops of avocado on top of it all. The toppings and ingredients are always so fresh.

A couple downfalls: First being the neighborhood. Now it's not as terrible as some of these little porcelain dolls on Yelp are making it out to be, but no, it's not a great area.

Second, the meat isn't always clean and can be pretty fatty. There were some gooey bits in my carnitas the first time I visited, which can be gnarly, but isn't a deal-breaker. Also, they're SUPER heavy on the cilantro and onions, so you better holler if you're not interested in that.

Lastly, they're cash only, so be prepared for that. Other than these few things, if I'm in the mood for a massive burrito that's a bit out of the norm, I'll come here.
author: Tyler H.

description: My freshly- made fish tacos were fantastic. I liked the simplicity of the fresh flavors in the regular fish taco, but the super taco (loaded with cheese, sour cream, avocado...) was delicious too.
author: Brian R.

description: Fantastic burrito! Incredibly filling. And that's coming from a Texan who knows his Mexican!
author: Stephen S.

description: Fantastic vegetarian burrito, which I added avocado to. I'm in town from out East and was craving a low-key joint near my hotel to fulfill my raging burrito craving. Totally delivered! And they have beer!
author: Nick G.

description: Amazing! The super tacos are the best, but try the quesadilla castillo if you're a cheese fan! I basically climaxed when I took the first bite.
author: Jake H.

description: The most amazing burrito and quesadilla i' be ever had. The place isn't that appealing at first but once you get your food you'll be shocked how good it is. Also: free nachos and smiles.
author: Barbi S.

description: Disgusting - just went here and the chicken was raw. Do not come here
author: Anne K.

description: This was a very yummy, fresh steak and avocado burrito I just ate.. I'm one of those people who hates gristle in my meat. This meat is juicy and gristle free. Worth ever 9 dollar (the price was right) perfect on the go food if you're in Union Square
author: Shannon P.

description:
The burrito was huge and bomb. Super tender chicken and huge chunks of avocado.

Unfortunately there was a homeless man that literally smoked a full cigarette and smoked a crack rock while sitting  at one of the tables. No one said anything!!! I wish I was joking. Surreal experience for sure.
author: Rik R.

description:
Tucked away from the hustle and bustle, Castillo Mason offers a great work lunch alternative for local businesses.  Unlike popular Taqueria Cancun (6th and Market), 
CM offers larger dining space and the comfort of some special lemonade mix.  Though this establishment doesn't serve up anything special, the portions are generous to give you enough for both lunch and dinner.  The carne asada left something to be desired but the carnitas was sufficiently spiced and tender.  Don't let the surroundings and the free startup lunches from venturing out to CM!
